articles.description: Newly appointed England head coach Thomas Tuchel says he wants to make the nation's "dream come true" at the 2026 World Cup.
articles.title: Thomas Tuchel: New England head coach wants to 'make our dream come true' at 2026 World Cup

articles.description: Pakistan’s spinners rip through the England middle order to turn the second Test on its head on the second day in Multan.
articles.title: Pakistan vs England: Sajid Khan stuns tourists after Ben Duckett century

articles.description: Follow live text commentary from the Women's Champions League as Manchester City travel to face St Polten and Arsenal take on Valerenga.
articles.title: Women's Champions League LIVE: St Polten vs Manchester City & Arsenal vs Valerenga - scores & text

articles.description: BBC Sport analyses the Formula 1 title battle including the factors that may help Lando Norris overhaul Max Verstappen.
articles.title: Formula 1 title race: What does Lando Norris need to do to beat Max Verstappen?

articles.description: Great Britain win both races on Wednesday to halve New Zealand's lead in the America's Cup in Barcelona.
articles.title: America's Cup: Great Britain cut New Zealand lead to 4-2 in Barcelona

articles.description: Lionel Messi scores his 10th international hat-trick and sets up two goals as Argentina maintain a three-point lead at the top of World Cup qualifying.
articles.title: Argentina 6-0 Bolivia: Lionel Messi scores hat-trick in World Cup qualifying

articles.description: BBC Sport has a look at some of the questions that have arisen from Thomas Tuchel's appointment as England head coach.
articles.title: Thomas Tuchel named England head coach - all you need to know about appointment

articles.description: Seven-time Super Bowl winner Tom Brady is "incredibly humbled and excited" that NFL team owners have approved his investment in the Las Vegas Raiders.
articles.title: Tom Brady: Las Vegas Raiders stake approved for NFL legend

articles.description: England opener Ben Duckett says Pakistan can "crumble" and are under "pressure", despite the home side ending day two of the second Test in the stronger position.
articles.title: Pakistan vs England: Ben Duckett says hosts could 'crumble' under 'pressure'

articles.description: Centre Henry Slade and flanker Tom Curry recover from injury to make England's 36-man squad for the autumn internationals, but first-choice scrum-half Alex Mitchell is out with a neck problem.
articles.title: Slade and Curry return for England, but Mitchell out
